meaning: sống dưới nước, thuộc về nước.

example.sentence: living or growing in, happening in, or connected with water.
example.meaning-example: sống dưới nước, thuộc về nước.
example.ipa-example: /ˈlɪv.ɪŋ ɔːr ˈɡrəʊ.ɪŋ ɪn, ˈhæp.ən.ɪŋ ɪn, ɔːr kəˈnek.tɪd wɪð ˈwɔː.tər./

example.sentence: Swimming is my favorite aquatic sport.
example.ipa-example: /ˈswɪm.ɪŋ ɪz maɪ ˈfeɪ.vər.ɪt əˈkwæt.ɪk spɔːt./

meaning: sinh quyển (phần của Trái Đất có sự sống).

example.sentence: the part of the earth's surface and atmosphere where there are living things.
example.meaning-example: sinh quyển (phần của Trái Đất có sự sống).
example.ipa-example: /ðə pɑːt əv ðɪ ɜːθs ˈsɜː.fɪs ænd ˈæt.mə.sfɪər weər ðeər ɑːr ˈlɪv.ɪŋ θɪŋz./

example.sentence: Even though people can’t see me, I’m an important part of Earth’s biosphere.

example.sentence: The biosphere includes all life on Earth.

example.sentence: Pollution is a danger to the biosphere.

example.sentence: We must protect the Earth's biosphere.
example.ipa-example: /wiː mʌst prəˈtekt ðɪ ɜːθs ˈbaɪ.əʊ.sfɪər./

meaning: kỳ quái, kỳ lạ, khác thường.

example.sentence: The movie had a bizarre ending.
example.ipa-example: /ðə ˈmuː.vi hæd ə bɪˈzɑːr ˈen.dɪŋ./

meaning: độ C (đơn vị đo nhiệt độ).

example.ipa-example: /hɪz kɔːs ˈswet.ər wɒz ʌnˈkʌm.fər.tə.bl̩./

meaning: bạn đồng hành, người đi cùng.

example.sentence: a person you spend a lot of time with often because you are friends or because you are travelling together.

example.sentence: I don’t need a companion to mate with.

example.sentence: He has been my trusted companion for years.

meaning: tiêu hóa.

meaning: khoảng thời gian, thời lượng.

meaning: sinh thái học.

meaning: kỳ công, thành tích đáng nể.

meaning: nhân (của tế bào).

meaning: sự chịu đựng, lòng khoan dung.

example.sentence: willingness to accept behaviour and beliefs that are different from your own, although you might not agree with them.
example.meaning-example: sự chịu đựng, lòng khoan dung.
example.ipa-example: /ˈwɪl.ɪŋ.nəs tuː əkˈsept bɪˈheɪv.jər ænd bɪˈliːfs ðæt ɑːr ˈdɪf.rənt frɒm jɔːr əʊn, ɔːlˈðəʊ juː maɪt nɒt əˈɡriː wɪð ðəm./

example.sentence: I have a very high tolerance for extreme conditions.
example.ipa-example: /aɪ hæv ə ˈver.i haɪ ˈtɒl.ər.əns fɔːr ɪkˈstriːm kənˈdɪʃ.ənz./

example.sentence: She has a high tolerance for pain.
example.ipa-example: /ʃiː hæz ə haɪ ˈtɒl.ər.əns fɔː peɪn./

example.sentence: My tolerance for noise is very low.
example.ipa-example: /maɪ ˈtɒl.ər.əns fɔː nɔɪz ɪz ˈver.i ləʊ./

example.sentence: He has no tolerance for people who are late.
example.ipa-example: /hiː hæz nəʊ ˈtɒl.ər.əns fɔː ˈpiː.pl̩ huː ɑːr leɪt./

meaning: trải qua, chịu đựng.

example.sentence: to experience something that is unpleasant or something that involves a change.
example.meaning-example: trải qua, chịu đựng.
example.ipa-example: /tuː ɪkˈspɪə.ri.əns ˈsʌm.θɪŋ ðæt ɪz ʌnˈplez.ənt ɔːr ˈsʌm.θɪŋ ðæt ɪnˈvɒlvz ə tʃeɪndʒ./

example.sentence: Instead, I undergo a process called fission, where my own nucleus splits in half.
example.ipa-example: /ɪnˈsted, aɪ ˌʌn.dəˈɡəʊ ə ˈprəʊ.ses kɔːld ˈfɪʃ.ən, weər maɪ əʊn ˈnjuː.kli.əs splɪts ɪn hɑːf./

example.sentence: The country is undergoing many changes.
example.ipa-example: /ðə ˈkʌn.tri ɪz ˌʌn.dəˈɡəʊ.ɪŋ ˈmen.i ˈtʃeɪn.dʒɪz./

example.sentence: All new employees must undergo a training program.
example.ipa-example: /ɔːl nuː ɪmˈplɔɪ.iːz mʌst ˌʌn.dəˈɡəʊ ə ˈtreɪn.ɪŋ ˈprəʊ.ɡræm./

example.sentence: The old building will undergo renovation next year.
example.ipa-example: /ði əʊld ˈbɪl.dɪŋ wɪl ˌʌn.dəˈɡəʊ ˌren.əˈveɪ.ʃən nekst jɪər./

meaning: dễ bị tổn thương, yếu đuối.

example.sentence: able to be easily physically, emotionally, or mentally hurt, influenced, or attacked.
example.meaning-example: dễ bị tổn thương, yếu đuối.
example.ipa-example: /ˈeɪ.bl̩ tuː bi ˈiː.zɪ.li ˈfɪz.ɪ.kəl.i, ɪˈməʊ.ʃən.əl.i, ɔːr ˈmen.təl.i hɜːt, ˈɪn.flu.ənst, ɔːr əˈtækt./

example.sentence: When I get hungry, I look for tiny, vulnerable parasites.
example.ipa-example: /wen aɪ ɡet ˈhʌŋ.ɡri, aɪ lʊk fɔː ˈtaɪ.ni, ˈvʌl.nər.ə.bəl ˈpær.ə.saɪts./

example.sentence: He felt very vulnerable and alone.
example.ipa-example: /hiː felt ˈver.i ˈvʌl.nər.ə.bəl ænd əˈləʊn./

example.sentence: The computer system is vulnerable to attack.
example.ipa-example: /ðə kəmˈpjuː.tər ˈsɪs.təm ɪz ˈvʌl.nər.ə.bəl tuː əˈtæk./

example.sentence: She was in a vulnerable position.
example.ipa-example: /ʃiː wɒz ɪn ə ˈvʌl.nər.ə.bəl pəˈzɪʃ.ən./

example.sentence: Even though people can’t see me, I’m an important part of Earth’s biosphere.
example.ipa-example: /ˈiː.vən ðəʊ ˈpiː.pl̩ kɑːnt siː miː, aɪm ən ɪmˈpɔː.tənt pɑːt əv ɜːθs ˈbaɪ.əʊ.sfɪər./

example.sentence: Scientists who study ecology know that I was the first life form on Earth.
example.ipa-example: /ˈsaɪən.tɪsts huː ˈstʌd.i iˈkɒl.ə.dʒi nəʊ ðæt aɪ wɒz ðə fɜːst laɪf fɔːm ɒn ɜːθ./

example.sentence: There is more of my kind than any other plant or animal in the world.
example.ipa-example: /ðeər ɪz mɔːr əv maɪ kaɪnd ðæn ˈen.i ˈʌð.ər plænt ɔːr ˈæn.ɪ.məl ɪn ðə wɜːld./

example.sentence: Without me, other plants and animals would not even exist, lama protist, and my tiny body is made up of one single cell.
example.ipa-example: /wɪˈðaʊt miː, ˈʌð.ər plænts ænd ˈæn.ɪ.məlz wʊd nɒt ˈiː.vən ɪɡˈzɪst, ˈlɑː.mə ˈprəʊ.tɪst, ænd maɪ ˈtaɪ.ni ˈbɒd.i ɪz meɪd ʌp əv wʌn ˈsɪŋ.ɡl̩ sel./

example.sentence: In my small world, things can be absolutely bizarre.
example.ipa-example: /ɪn maɪ smɔːl wɜːld, θɪŋz kæn bi ˈæb.sə.luːt.li bɪˈzɑːr./

example.sentence: Unlike most aquatic plants and animals, I don’t need a temperate climate.
example.ipa-example: /ʌnˈlaɪk məʊst əˈkwæt.ɪk plænts ænd ˈæn.ɪ.məlz, aɪ dəʊnt niːd ə ˈtem.pər.ət ˈklaɪ.mət./

example.sentence: I have a very high tolerance for extreme conditions.
example.ipa-example: /aɪ hæv ə ˈver.i haɪ ˈtɒl.ər.əns fɔːr ɪkˈstriːm kənˈdɪʃ.ənz./

example.sentence: Right now, I’m swimming around in a bucket of boiling water!
example.ipa-example: /raɪt naʊ, aɪm ˈswɪm.ɪŋ əˈraʊnd ɪn ə ˈbʌk.ɪt əv ˈbɔɪl.ɪŋ ˈwɔː.tər!/

example.sentence: The temperature is 150 degrees Celsius, but I feel comfortable.
example.ipa-example: /ðə ˈtem.prə.tʃər ɪz wʌn ˈhʌn.drəd fɪf.ti dɪˈɡriːz ˈsel.si.əs, bʌt aɪ fiːl ˈkʌm.fər.tə.bl̩./

example.sentence: I have coarse hairs called cilia that help me swim around in here.
example.ipa-example: /aɪ hæv kɔːs heərz kɔːld ˈsɪl.i.ə ðæt help miː swɪm əˈraʊnd ɪn hɪər./

example.sentence: I move my cilia in a repetitive motion for the duration of my swim.
example.ipa-example: /aɪ muːv maɪ ˈsɪl.i.ə ɪn ə rɪˈpet.ə.tɪv ˈməʊ.ʃən fɔː ðə dʒʊəˈreɪ.ʃən əv maɪ swɪm./

example.sentence: I cannot go very fast, though.
example.ipa-example: /aɪ ˈkæn.ɒt ɡəʊ ˈver.i fɑːst, ðəʊ./

example.sentence: It takes me about five minutes to swim a distance of just one millimeter!
example.ipa-example: /ɪt teɪks miː əˈbaʊt faɪv ˈmɪn.ɪts tuː swɪm ə ˈdɪs.təns əv dʒʌst wʌn ˈmɪl.ɪˌmiː.tər!/

example.sentence: When I get hungry, I look for tiny, vulnerable parasites.
example.ipa-example: /wen aɪ ɡet ˈhʌŋ.ɡri, aɪ lʊk fɔː ˈtaɪ.ni, ˈvʌl.nər.ə.bəl ˈpær.ə.saɪts./

example.sentence: I swim up to one and swallow it whole.
example.ipa-example: /aɪ swɪm ʌp tuː wʌn ænd ˈswɒl.əʊ ɪt həʊl./

example.sentence: I digest things much like people do.
example.ipa-example: /aɪ daɪˈdʒest θɪŋz mʌtʃ laɪk ˈpiː.pl̩ duː./

example.sentence: I have an organ that works just like a human stomach.
example.ipa-example: /aɪ hæv ən ˈɔːr.ɡən ðæt wɜːks dʒʌst laɪk ə ˈhjuː.mən ˈstʌm.ək./

example.sentence: After I eat, I release nitrogen gas.
example.ipa-example: /ˈɑːf.tər aɪ iːt, aɪ rɪˈliːs ˈnaɪ.trə.dʒən ɡæs./

example.sentence: Nitrogen is a prominent gas in the earth’s atmosphere.
example.ipa-example: /ˈnaɪ.trə.dʒən ɪz ə ˈprɒm.ɪ.nənt ɡæs ɪn ðɪ ɜːθs ˈæt.mə.sfɪər./

example.sentence: Other plants and animals need my nitrogen to survive.
example.ipa-example: /ˈʌð.ər plænts ænd ˈæn.ɪ.məlz niːd maɪ ˈnaɪ.trə.dʒən tuː sərˈvaɪv./

example.sentence: My reproductive ability is my most unique trait.
example.ipa-example: /maɪ ˌriː.prəˈdʌk.tɪv əˈbɪl.ɪ.ti ɪz maɪ məʊst juːˈniːk treɪt./

example.sentence: I don’t need a companion to mate with.
example.ipa-example: /aɪ dəʊnt niːd ə kəmˈpæn.jən tuː meɪt wɪð./

example.sentence: Instead, I undergo a process called fission, where my own nucleus splits in half.
example.ipa-example: /ɪnˈsted, aɪ ˌʌn.dəˈɡəʊ ə ˈprəʊ.ses kɔːld ˈfɪʃ.ən, weər maɪ əʊn ˈnjuː.kli.əs splɪts ɪn hɑːf./

example.sentence: An exact copy of my nucleus is made, which forms into another protist.
example.ipa-example: /æn ɪɡˈzækt ˈkɒp.i əv maɪ ˈnjuː.kli.əs ɪz meɪd, wɪtʃ fɔːmz ˈɪn.tuː əˈnʌð.ər ˈprəʊ.tɪst./

example.sentence: It really is an impressive feat.
example.ipa-example: /ɪt ˈriːə.li ɪz ən ɪmˈpres.ɪv fiːt./

example.sentence: I can create an infinite number of new protists all by myself!
example.ipa-example: /aɪ kæn kriˈeɪt ən ˈɪn.fɪ.nət ˈnʌm.bər əv nuː ˈprəʊ.tɪsts ɔːl baɪ maɪˈself!/
